    Class: BufferedBlockAlgorithm

    Defined in: src/algbase.iced

    Overview

    Abstract buffered block algorithm template.

    The property blockSize must be implemented in a concrete subtype.

    _minBufferSize The number of blocks that should be kept unprocessed in the buffer. Default: 0

    Direct Known Subclasses

    Hasher

    Instance Method Summary

    • - (void) constructor() Constructor Does little other than eset/initialize internal state.
    • - (void) reset() Resets this block algorithm's data buffer to its initial state.
    • - (void) _append(data) Adds new data to this block algorithm's buffer.
    • - (WordArray) _process(doFlush) Processes available data blocks.
    • - (void) copy_to(out) Copy the contents of the algorithm base to the given target object (of the same class).
    • - (Object) clone() Creates a copy of this object.

    Constructor Details

    - (void) constructor()

    Does little other than eset/initialize internal state.

    Instance Method Details

    - (void) reset()

    Resets this block algorithm's data buffer to its initial state.

    - (void) _append(data)

    Adds new data to this block algorithm's buffer.

    Examples:

      bufferedBlockAlgorithm._append(wordArray);

    Parameters:

    • data (WordArray) — The data to append. Strings are converted to a WordArray using UTF-8.

    - (WordArray) _process(doFlush)

    Processes available data blocks.

    This method invokes _doProcessBlock(offset), which must be implemented by a concrete subtype.

    Examples:

    processedData = bufferedBlockAlgorithm._process();
processedData = bufferedBlockAlgorithm._process(!!'flush');

    Parameters:

    • doFlush (boolean) — Whether all blocks and partial blocks should be processed.

    Returns:

    • (WordArray) — The processed data.

    - (void) copy_to(out)

    Copy the contents of the algorithm base to the given target object (of the same class). Used in cloning.

    Parameters:

    • out (BufferedBlockAlgorithm) — The object to copy to.

    - (Object) clone()

    Creates a copy of this object.

    Returns:

    • (Object) — The clone.
